elements.2211.03229_06d82801318012b58f7c9c2b23598: algorithms can be used to automatically summarize legal case decisions, most fail to incorporate domain knowledge about how important sentences in a legal decision relate to a representation of its document structure
elements.2211.03229_284d41acc2e405e88897115975559: For example, analysis of a legal case summarization dataset demonstrates that sentences serving different types of argumentative roles in the decision appear in different sections
elements.2211.03229_41854c2fea50f22b45e0a42e1cd71: In this work, we propose an unsupervised graph-based ranking model that uses a reweighting algorithm to exploit properties of the document structure of legal case decisions
elements.2211.03229_3d4bd76d1ad41f4db16d41c388d45: We also explore the impact of using different methods to compute the document structure
elements.2211.03229_6e472b727a97482cf77c44affba10: Results on the Canadian Legal Case Law
elements.2211.03229_ce1230f59a3ac25273cbdd033c862: dataset show that our proposed method outperforms several strong
elements.2211.03229_68294ce57a03a49e03fc93a5917d1: Single document summarization aims at rephrasing a long text into a shorter version while preserving the important information
elements.2211.03229_7b52c72c53bb76274b0749f2716fb: While recent years have witnessed a blooming of abstractive summarization models that can generate fluent and coherent new wordings
elements.2211.03229_5daccd9ac2fea9ac6370c6e902a30: In contrast, extractive summarization models directly select sentences/phrases from the source document to form a summary
elements.2211.03229_c0e6af3658e442010229c0a8763ad: In certain domains such as the law or science
elements.2211.03229_cbbd8ec62dbb45cf2f2c2b5fe578d: , using exact wordings may be needed
elements.2211.03229_ffb96e0b52559bf6f93a6e64cf77c: In this work, we focus on
elements.2211.03229_5b9cbeaa2b05853ae2fdf2a5ca5c7: Different from texts in the news domain, case texts tend to be longer (e.g., in Canadian legal case decisions
elements.2211.03229_d18796733013d8a96ddf51b08992a: there are on average 3.9k words, while standard news articles
elements.2211.03229_ffcefdee0576284dcee49b46cbf31: range from 400 - 800 words) and also have more complicated document structures (e.g., legal cases are likely to be split into sections while news articles are not).
elements.2211.03229_614c70bfd38dc6e612017719151e2: In contrast to scientific domains, which also have long and structured texts, large
elements.2211.03229_71f7484563d65805ea8ed21fe67be: training sets of case decisions and reference summaries are generally not freely available given the restrictions of the legal field.
elements.2211.03229_d679b7d83726ede0586d4c7f3ba94: dataset has less than 30k training examples
elements.2211.03229_dc766fd81a21aa7e13981df4b9fe8: , which is ten times less than scientific datasets such as arXiv and PubMed
elements.2211.03229_08d8534ef1fd1df090b3c7df78c49: Thus, for the legal domain, it is not surprising that
elements.2211.03229_ba863f45edc761628a61d08845781: have attempted to directly apply standard unsupervised
elements.2211.03229_96c39583e5f5585eb540f831eabcb: to legal data, they have obtained mediocre results
elements.2211.03229_a679587633b2f27769575990d020f: However, most such attempts have failed to utilize the
elements.2211.03229_1b24562e3a967b7806064366add75: important sentences about the issues versus the decisions of the court occur in different places in the document structure
elements.2211.03229_883cdba01cd46b89902e0daa6a2a2: In contrast, summarization algorithms typically flatten any structure during initial processing (i.e., they concatenate sentences from different sections/paragraphs of a document to form a sentence list),
elements.2211.03229_bf05d767c7502f5e7d31f365880e4: or select sentences using structural biases from other domains (e.g., the importance of leading sentences in news
elements.2211.03229_8538ddced3d041b541c0bb1a697bd: correctly extracts the legal issue from the beginning of the source text, it incorrectly extracts several redundant sentences (i.e.,
elements.2211.03229_118303e19b957369fdb48eeb50e38: which talk about similar content) as well as ignores a large part of the article (e.g., no sentences are extracted from the last section of the original case:
elements.2211.03229_987fa9097f4926e2f5cccf89c2857: In contrast, the human summary focuses on sentences related to the argument of the legal decision (e.g., what are the issues, reasoning and conclusions of this court case?), which tend to be spread across the document structure.
elements.2211.03229_4cc69046fd2fcb5c89a4a78bb0237: Recently, the HipoRank model was proposed to exploit discourse structure patterns during unsupervised extractive summarization
elements.2211.03229_83c35312c31dcccde82a318ba0190: However, the model was designed for long scientific articles, and the experiments were based on data where the articles were already split into document sections.
elements.2211.03229_28cbf0446e9a4f1e855d32f817d42: For case decisions, document structures are generally either missing or only implicitly conveyed by text formatting
elements.2211.03229_19bb44eee88322a9d1dcb0505ebe6: , document sections are conveyed by bolding in the source HTML file.
elements.2211.03229_ae2b5bd1f9bb3b0e9f1b9ec9701fe: Moreover, algorithms such as PACSUM and HipoRank compute sentence centrality just once and greedily select the top-k candidates
elements.2211.03229_753bd3458ff5091ffe768c04f4ebd: fails to match the distribution of the argumentative sentences that ultimately appear in human case law summaries.
elements.2211.03229_0b8c4e27b15bcd1665d52aa823d1c: To address these limitations, we investigate the utility of different methods for
elements.2211.03229_fe74f82f3f7a112d28b7eca559ea2: segmenting the sentences of legal case decisions into the sections of a document structure
elements.2211.03229_9eb4e07fdd6f1614d9b9038e00996: could bring improvements in summarization quality when discourse-aware methods such as HipoRank are applied to legal case decisions.
elements.2211.03229_0ab64308cacd67628bb6fd957922c: to improve how HipoRank selects sentences when creating extractive summaries of legal decisions
elements.2211.03229_9a92dcae01e86c410dcb5348c4dee: takes the history of already selected summary sentences into account, and gradually updates the importance score of a sentence
elements.2211.03229_f800d50472a87e43b68ba9fef8657: We posit that reweighting will decrease the selection of redundant sentences as well as increase the selection of argumentative sentences from less-represented document segments (e.g., in the middle)
elements.2211.03229_ade51a67343d973101b96c931b2e4: for summarizing legal decisions using an annotated Canadian case summarization dataset (CanLII)
elements.2211.03229_8cdd5c44ed86d513d753a93bab7ee: will capture the important sentences to summarize in a legal decision
elements.2211.03229_584697cfe5de11fbba0514edd41b0: , a portion of the CanLLI dataset comes with gold-standard sentence-level labels identifying which sentences are related to the issue/reasoning/conclusion of the court's decision in both source and summary documents
elements.2211.03229_f652aed79a6385bd8a78bbf6e6117: We use these labels to additionally propose a metric that can better evaluate the quality of the generated summary from a legal expert's perspective
elements.2211.03229_a791cf97a8dc955fa44a0c27efcae: Empirical results show that our method improves performance over previous unsupervised models
elements.2211.03229_128116bf741305a0e936903533f8e: Graph-based methods have been exploited for extractive summarization tasks to better model the inter-sentence relations based on document structure.
elements.2211.03229_ba921e2ab18858e46900d62ce5c1a: applied a GCN layer to aggregate information from the document's discourse graph based on RST trees and dependencies
elements.2211.03229_d7ce2669a2562a20385d0a4fad583: started to incorporate the hierarchical structure and topic structure of scientific articles into supervised model training, respectively
elements.2211.03229_87662a7e557151fd6b2cdc37dde33: However, HiSruct+ relied on the relatively fixed and explicit document structure of scientific articles
elements.2211.03229_004687029ec3870e9a4924e5eb6fb: while HEGEL relied on a large training set to identify the topic distributions.
elements.2211.03229_5292f7f0c902c216fae1fba73c642: We leave the exploration of the aforementioned supervised approaches on legal domain texts for future work.
elements.2211.03229_0b99c1d7929b2db49f542136d79e7: Traditional extractive summarization methods are mostly unsupervised
elements.2211.03229_56fb6a4f730f0119f9769597b629f: , where a large portion apply the graph-based algorithms
elements.2211.03229_7ca2b4986a24a7b346dad44aa922c: or are based on term frequencies such as n-gram overlaps
elements.2211.03229_b11f349139e54eec0f4e284771aac: built directed unsupervised graph-based models on news articles using BERT-based sentence representations and achieved comparable performance to supervised models on multiple benchmarks.
elements.2211.03229_aef034e3d4a1aae82a59aca99fda4: with sentence position and section hierarchy to reflect the document structure of scientific articles.
elements.2211.03229_f739d2ba8586b60af2f5c0d91893f: Despite the success of supervised neural network models in news and scientific article summarization
elements.2211.03229_9b571cb5c6906eb8c96a4f2f9aa9d: , they face challenges in legal document summarization given the longer texts, distinct document structure, and limited training data
elements.2211.03229_50061cbbea3baad8be5dca0e8a954: Instead, prior work has tackled legal extractive summarization by applying domain independent unsupervised algorithms
elements.2211.03229_3a04d8edfa4a8464ea166f6fc1f1a: , or designing domain specific supervised approaches
elements.2211.03229_a425afc09531f65f2ef0c3f6c4b1a: frames the task as Integer Linear Programming and demonstrates the importance of in-domain structure and legal knowledge.
elements.2211.03229_e279c62fd367e66796f4ec947d969: propose a sentence classification task with the hope of exploiting the court decision's
elements.2211.03229_b98866506fb640df2b908d1e9cf2f: by making explicit its issues, conclusions, and reasons (i.e., argument triples).
elements.2211.03229_e42277474267742def59619306098: Recent work has introduced a number of legal document summarization or salient information identification tasks with associated datasets, e.g., for bill
elements.2211.03229_a124248921318a88a91a51982df5d: and for case sentence argumentive classification
elements.2211.03229_1bba625aacc82a2b645fe995002da:

elements.2211.03229_a7dc710bac85dd5bd42a403762844: (Canadian Legal Information Institute) dataset of legal case decisions and summaries
elements.2211.03229_0cce0a9734ef54b2a721a1d6bfaac: Full corpus statistics are provided in Table
elements.2211.03229_305872ae7d74b2380b97c57e6b0e5: , while an example case/summary pair from the test set is provided in Figure
elements.2211.03229_3b99ed1235c568f7bf9e21661c356: only used a small portion of this dataset for their work in argumentative classification
elements.2211.03229_242cdec366e82d67200767689f5ce: Conjecturing that explicitly identifying the decision's argumentative components would be crucial in case summarization, they annotated 1,049 case and human-written summary pairs curated from the full dataset.
elements.2211.03229_1520bb4f8a7a243c98e61cc589054: In particular, they recruited legal experts to annotate the document on the sentence level, adopting an
elements.2211.03229_68dfede41a82ce665c954e6e89180: ) which classifies individual sentences into one of four categories:
elements.2211.03229_0ef7220326f2d243b1616915bb08c: (text snippets explaining why the court made such conclusion) and
elements.2211.03229_5760003033bc3fb10a0216fc5ee94: The distributions of the IRC labels in the cases and summaries are shown in Figure
elements.2211.03229_b14ffeb85d1d9a80ce02ab90ff55d: and illustrate that argumentative sentences do indeed play an important role in human summaries
elements.2211.03229_b384e76b91cfb4a20ad7008a8b407: We utilized the unannotated 27,241 pairs to train a supervised model baseline and the 1049 annotated pairs as our test set
elements.2211.03229_66e71def107dac734a5263585221e: While none of our summarization methods use the IRC annotations, they are used during testing as the basis of a domain-specific evaluation metric.
elements.2211.03229_98423b050253a9f16b42c03bba3f2: We propose a reweighting model that employs a
elements.2211.03229_45761cc0a2cf9c06969b0d177be9a: graph-based ranking algorithm to exploit the
elements.2211.03229_3a38d15bf554326223a2741898a5a: structures encoded in long legal case decisions.
elements.2211.03229_98b37ff0541651bf8b99bae7cd8b6: The HipoRank (Hierarchical and Positional Ranking) model recently developed by
elements.2211.03229_133a2878c2789e60e98a2688ee5a9: constructs a directed graph for document representation using document section and sentence hierarchies.
elements.2211.03229_ae8de6982329cf57dc5c4d4f1a04b: HipoRank computes the centrality score of each sentence as
elements.2211.03229_0230ae1727e8d73d50238b47514c5: computes the sentence's similarity to other section representations and
elements.2211.03229_8448ef7d0e239b961fdfa0063fd10: computes the average similarity of the current sentence with all others in the same section.
elements.2211.03229_f3a33583dd5d5b1948926aab4096b: HipoRank then selects the top-K ranked sentences as the summary
elements.2211.03229_5b94393cd64e0d5c1192eede58206: More details of the algorithm are provided in Appendix
elements.2211.03229_e844f74e743f691395f0f67ed1b48: Directly applying HipoRank to our data yielded multiple challenges (e.g., redundant neighboring sentences
elements.2211.03229_465ae26c9e187b94f828db83f1c27: ) as well as too many sentences from the ends of the article were selected).
elements.2211.03229_892331b7b3604736d80a6616e6ce2: document graph, the document must be split into sections and sentences.
elements.2211.03229_5dafffaa32f1a3a5f4cb87550349f: shows different structures for the same case.
elements.2211.03229_275253ea6feabb4973012c3b0cdbc: This approach extracts the structure by processing the
elements.2211.03229_aac843c0d6624c1ee3df143bc2c67: We use a heuristic to mark the section names with an italic and bold format as the
elements.2211.03229_dbe3573736b77c404565c0db47240: boundaries and segment the documents into multiple continuous sections
elements.2211.03229_7d9fad65aa9b3553c54e4a8612fd1: It is worth noting that 297 of the 1049 test case documents do not come with explicit section splits, thus we treat them as whole text spans
elements.2211.03229_05bec95fd8191025487f212d5f330: Meanwhile, we also explore using a traditional,
elements.2211.03229_9d4d17534fb81c96e6a294a0033a5: but with advanced sentence representation from SBERT
elements.2211.03229_742066264caf3aeaf68ef16240c3a: to group neighboring sentences into topic blocks.
elements.2211.03229_881640d6a37605e4d55d93a1f945f: Early studies found that legal documents tend to have well-defined,
elements.2211.03229_7ee83e560f91e86ccecae6189a74a: Following work that extracts stage views in conversations (introductions â problem exploration â problem solving â wrap up)
elements.2211.03229_e9280b4e789d3d489e9924a8731a3: , we extract thematic stages through a Hidden Markov Model (HMM)
elements.2211.03229_07d6c7d607bb6af52ff11f628555d: A fixed order of stages is imposed and only consecutive transitions are allowed between neighboring stages
elements.2211.03229_9e8f40e917b174d1fa9141b6b8ab0: and set the number of stages as 5, including the starting Decision Data, Introduction, Context, Judicial Analysis, and Conclusion, as introduced by
elements.2211.03229_d461efb094903f7b3135c892f9c8b: Preliminary analysis demonstrated that the raw CanLII documents fail to distinguish the less important headers at the beginning (i.e., the descriptive text before the main content, for example, the content above the grey splitting line and BASIS OF CLAIM in Figure
elements.2211.03229_f68bbdd54bc82fd1b0c988422c603: Generated summaries also tend to cover a large portion of such information
elements.2211.03229_db7aecddade7d85211c5fd3a0225e: We thus propose a legal case decision preprocessing procedure following certain heuristics
elements.2211.03229_3ef4f9f85eea95087b0d1e7fc4988: to remove those headers, and demonstrate the improved summarization quality (for all views of document structure) in Section
elements.2211.03229_10bfbee1e38bebd8d5942648fd036: will not change once built, and the important sentences are greedily selected based on the aggregated centrality scores.
elements.2211.03229_5f827109d081121322c70b6c020c5: This may introduce redundancies in selecting similar sentences and ignore the contents in the middle of the source case decisions that are more important once the argumentative sentences at the beginning and end are taken into account
elements.2211.03229_b8f95d096178a627c3b86dc63506a: We propose a novel reweighting approach that can tackle this problem
elements.2211.03229_ca65816ba0e8359b5db8426b9bb34: on multi-round selection looked at the local similarity between
elements.2211.03229_2aebd2f0077484dab150e7c530d45: They iteratively recompute the sentence to sentence similarities between the selected summary sentences and recompute the final sentence centrality scores after each sentence selection
elements.2211.03229_175886666d2f82fc285b8659c7e47: Instead, we are focusing on modeling the relationship between the selected sentence and the other candidate sentences
elements.2211.03229_acb8f6114b178a643772f7abd5811: Their method is also not directly applicable to longer text due to the
elements.2211.03229_5594a5d1d00c746934eae66bb4ebb: time complexity of computation given large numbers of sentences (on average 205 sentences for CanLII dataset).
elements.2211.03229_b82705fe72628232068c5e09627c1: for different section d 's embedding, and a threshold
elements.2211.03229_0150434232c96bbb1ee3ccdbf60fb: for phase transition and maximum summary length
elements.2211.03229_be73b6e093afa6b80490eb5c41c90: Our approach can be divided into two phases, as shown in Algorithm
elements.2211.03229_e9ad014dc0d25049413d70b64be11: In the first phase, we assume that important argumentative sentences at the two ends of the document can be easily detected (as shown in Figures
elements.2211.03229_703b44b81f0d2d0dda080ee483dc4: , legal case documents generally start by introducing the issues and end with conclusions)
elements.2211.03229_b65dc7dd1c99f99a7de456adbc3e1: A quantitative analysis of the top-5 selected sentences in CanLII in fact provides an 80
elements.2211.03229_fcc6d611c9d010f4c1a58758a6e87: coverage of issue or conclusion sentences
elements.2211.03229_327461bbc34e42837a14b7987c17d: We thus set up a threshold to pick the first k sentences based on the original document graphs
elements.2211.03229_76177ad88756feb6eaf2be9c4419a: Afterward, we gradually downweight the sentence's centrality score using the location of the latest selected sentence, that is, we set a penalty score for sentences that are placed as a neighbor of the current sentence selected for the summary
elements.2211.03229_1d6278537b6a6bb6820e8f7c98307: reasoning sentences are more likely to be located in different sections in the middle that are not shared with issues and conclusions.
elements.2211.03229_d2c85513c3333acc6be56b715c998: For supervised models, we split the training data in an 80:20 ratio for training and validation
elements.2211.03229_fe92ff90d3de3f67a058d30cd07fb: For unsupervised models, we tune the hyperparameters on the validation set
elements.2211.03229_540940c631abf94ac9e3187bdecb3: Model training details can be found in Appendix

elements.2211.03229_f83206db0651712ab240546c7f08f: We also propose metrics to measure the recall value of the annotated IRC types in the test set,
elements.2211.03229_fc152ba471fd17bf0ff35385c6993: which exploits the structure of case documents
elements.2211.03229_f744eb7cae63a54d7fa82fe40cc53: In this section, we aim to deal with three research questions:
elements.2211.03229_55641359df7297f2b23b675bd0e56: How well do the extractive baselines including the HipoRank backbone deal with legal documents?
elements.2211.03229_a83d846a3fdd5e55b9ebca13fda83: How well do the different views of document structures perform with the HipoRank backbone?
elements.2211.03229_c14d03a0ff8f44aebe24b20cbebe4: Can the reweighting algorithm help select important argumentative sentences and improve summary quality?
elements.2211.03229_0642e17e96c8d5dc137cfa0b7de8d: compares our methods with prior extractive models
elements.2211.03229_300c6d21328ca30e7731e0a7e8172: shows that there is still a gap between oracle models (rows 1 and 2) and current extractive baselines
elements.2211.03229_39fce1bd4da6346661e9d2cda82d9: There are around 20 points differences on R-1, R-2, and R-L. Among the baselines, the supervised model works best only for R-1 and R-L. Unsupervised methods obtain the highest BS (row 4) and R-2 (row 5), possibly due to the higher coverage of n-grams benefitting from longer extracted summaries (row 3 model generated summaries have an average length of 250; row 4-6 models generate on average 400-word summaries; row 7 and 8 models have a limit of 220 words).
elements.2211.03229_e9b92e69156cab8a09c7d6e504da2: never outperforms the best extractive baseline
elements.2211.03229_b53d6d47e9a8b28b56eb45776460d: However, if only unsupervised baselines are considered, HipoRank in row 12 does show the best performance for 3 of the 4 evaluation metrics.
elements.2211.03229_6356cf2f1113982201df56960a3f4: To examine the effects of the document views in Section
elements.2211.03229_f90870b6ebc5a8538648566ea78ea: , we split the document into different types of linear segments and then used HipoRank to generate summaries
elements.2211.03229_951106f64b5730d3c81091ef41924: Recall that HipoRank is the only model to exploit document structure, and as noted for RQ1, with the right structure could obtain the best unsupervised R-1, R-L, and BS baseline scores
elements.2211.03229_f19d0a35ebcdf94eee4a91c369164: When naively constructing different document structures from the CanLII dataset without header removal, using NLP algorithms (rows 9 - 10) versus just using the HTML formatting (row 8) generally degraded results
elements.2211.03229_1d64deaa9581f7480f265e2e9c2af: However, when we experimented with a modified version of the input documents (rows 11-13) where the headers were filtered through heuristics before computing the document structure,
elements.2211.03229_3beba442170a1b4b705927ab29c58: the scores in rows 11-13 were higher (or in one case the same) than the comparable scores in rows 8-10
elements.2211.03229_91ba562b94582eaaa56b093125c72: Also, without headers, the C99 topic segmentation algorithm (row 12) now outperforms the use of HTML (row 11) (obtaining an average improvement of 0.5 points across ROUGE and 0.8 for BS), suggesting that better structures can improve summarization.
elements.2211.03229_8063ac626ecca52b8e3860bede232: ), C99 creates many small sections (average number of sentences per section is 3.39 with standard deviation of 0.67)
elements.2211.03229_6b7ab099c4bfd3202d51a6b33b1fa: We hypothesize that this encourages the selection of sentences from more fine-grained segments
elements.2211.03229_3018b6d5e4b4d26c718037b672202: In contrast, the other two methods create lengthy sections (average of more than 50 sentences) with a large standard deviation (135.40 for original structure without headers).
elements.2211.03229_b861f909bf89aea05b53f93102e9d: In sum, with improvements in automatic metrics, we find that document structures play an important role in summarizing cases.

elements.2211.03229_4daba26fc11af7eea74275d6e9171: presents the reweighting results (using the "w/o header" version of the CanLLI documents as they performed best in the prior block).
elements.2211.03229_6d5006667b2b4667c5047562e1490: By downweighting sentences that appear under the same section as previously selected ones, we observe an F1 improvement of 0.65, 0.65, and 0.75 on R-1, R-2, and R-L, respectively, on the previously best-performing topic segmented document (row 12 versus 15).
elements.2211.03229_4517bfb20a2445a88c16ce5084f3c: Row 15 in fact has the best non-oracle results for all ROUGE scores
elements.2211.03229_113c614ea187ac257afc04e98194f: This observation regarding the value of reweighting also holds for the original structure (row 11 vs. 14) and the HMM-stage segments (row 13 vs. 16).
elements.2211.03229_b9824fc7e4211d5595a51f65c96f0: Finally, to better understand the behavior of different enhancements to the HipoRank backbone model, Figure
elements.2211.03229_b8b7087e5a39a669c04060d5f875b: visualizes the positions of IRC sentences in the original article that are selected by a particular summarization method
elements.2211.03229_2a16e936e197c9e3dbd717c7e0793: Plot (a) shows that the human-annotated IRC sentences in the summary tend to span across the source documents, with issues appearing in the beginning and conclusions in the end
elements.2211.03229_0cf5efbff42b30a6032b889b6f59d: Plot (b) shows that although HipoRank using the original document structure can successfully pick middle section sentences, the darkest band at the starting positions shows that the model still heavily relies on the inductive bias to pick the beginning sentences
elements.2211.03229_1f61478d1ed397ab08807a95292f1: Plot (c) shows that removing the headers reduces the starting sentence bias
elements.2211.03229_b3b1d394ce6ff678f62ae4785728d: reweighting reduces the number of sentences appearing on both ends
elements.2211.03229_a136f9072d6cdc0dc4570c102ebae: Further analyses on the complete automatic evaluation results
elements.2211.03229_8be2970f8a9585d36ce5c5b20430b: suggest that the improvements come from higher recall values.
elements.2211.03229_d3a4f102ce1bb144cdb48fbe8922b: Taking advantage of the sentence-level IRC annotations, we propose recall metrics to better measure the summary quality from a legal argumentation perspective (
elements.2211.03229_bfb5e9e156b2fef840ff453c63f2d: sentences extracted from the original case as source IRC coverage (src
elements.2211.03229_af582ae69b5287b6650fb28d26cd4: We similarly compute the coverage of IRC sentences in the human-written summaries as target IRC coverage (tgt
elements.2211.03229_cf06182be886aea784202f0ad278f: IRC) and all sentences as target sentence coverage (trg. cov.)
elements.2211.03229_bcbc5d774f801f1280fb192af2a1b: To do so we apply the oracle summarizer (Section
elements.2211.03229_808025030868ec8197819bab252ce: ) to map the generated extractive summaries to the human-written abstractive summaries.
elements.2211.03229_7decf0a2c8aea539ef00dfb9e03fd: We report these values for the IRC oracle,
elements.2211.03229_bebee0d89bf108f5229682ca05611: EXT) baseline, the discourse-aware HipoRank with the original structure, and our best reweighting model using C99-topic segmentation
elements.2211.03229_fc7bab5785f7215f10f39900ad938: shows that our model obtains the highest target IRC recall and coverage, suggesting that the summaries are more similar to the references with respect to
elements.2211.03229_8fe32d5f0404d99fcfd6e6bc7fc4a: Another unsupervised model, LexRank, obtains the highest source IRC, but its off-the-shelf package requires a fixed sentence ratio selected from the source.
elements.2211.03229_0d3902dc889f6edc3cc56be3e5414: This produced longer summaries than other approaches and thus captured more IRCs in the source.

elements.2211.03229_9971cfac2305a870ea641b18e3a77: As a first step towards human evaluation, we tried to extend the HipoRank setup in
elements.2211.03229_21b36a27e7cc10180a5777dc1535f: and designed a human evaluation protocol as follows
elements.2211.03229_d752a4674d57a5f9b6cbd41aa47b2: to read the human-written reference summary and presented extracted sentences from different summarization systems
elements.2211.03229_c556a287c51ac33256bca50236326: The judges were asked to evaluate a system-extracted sentence according to two criteria: (1)
elements.2211.03229_ed2c08d326612cd65355206e48676: - whether the presented sentence contained content from the human summary, and (2)
elements.2211.03229_090ed6cb803a222ac4bf97ada0100: - whether the presented sentence was important for a goal-oriented reader even if it was not in the human summary
elements.2211.03229_6738e0749158cba3b9d3fa8574b96: The sentence selection was anonymized and randomly shuffled
elements.2211.03229_59267c0b7a57c483d521a895d8aaf: We used the same sampling strategy in
elements.2211.03229_d6f550c79dbe1f959ff7c44d6afc3: to pick ten reference summaries where the system outputs were neutral (i.e., had similar R-2 scores compared to the human reference).
elements.2211.03229_4a25b5e2cd6b67a460d57d813b787: However, initial annotation on a small set by a legal expert demonstrated that the selected sentences may not reflect the model's capability
elements.2211.03229_db9eeaf8c29d8ca137257410d5911: Most sampled system outputs had low ROUGE-2 F1 scores compared to the reference (normally below 10
elements.2211.03229_9d05b1145aca79aa9fcb9bcc00833: while the average model performance is 17
elements.2211.03229_f44bbd1a90ee3342754ca2b970fc0: ), and the human evaluator reported that some of the selected sentences were not meaningful
elements.2211.03229_5a5969a0aca5ab6b8b8aed0460534: We thus propose that a more careful sampling technique will be required for legal annotation tasks such as ours
elements.2211.03229_c12abd88250e32e352ac4882d7323: To further guide our future work, we also reviewed how prior legal domain research has performed human evaluations when automatically summarizing legal documents
elements.2211.03229_7e2233d515e2c5a79241ff974f2f4: Due to the burden of reading lengthy original documents, as in our human evaluation, most prior work evaluated summary quality using reference summaries rather than source documents
elements.2211.03229_267ece983d51a8240d5ff52ee871f: In addition, legal evaluations have typically been small-scale
elements.2211.03229_089fc297d3c1af7df7d442804e926: (5-20 summaries) due to the need to have evaluators with particular types of expertise (e.g., law graduate students or law professors), which was a similar constraint in our exploratory human evaluation
elements.2211.03229_1878e81a0dcac2f90085dd591acb8: Researchers have also designed new types of legally-relevant evaluation questions that evaluate the summary for task-specific properties that go beyond more typical properties such as grammar, readability, and style
elements.2211.03229_3ce0401c0589c101947487d02f349: In our case, we would like legal experts to assess IRC coverage in the future.
elements.2211.03229_09c2381ca5cb40bb5276331787ec4: We presented an unsupervised graph-based model for the summarization of long legal case decisions
elements.2211.03229_01d3a79482e74afa09cc9086fdb3f: Our proposed approach incorporated diverse views of the document structure of legal cases and utilized a reweighting scheme to better select argumentative sentences
elements.2211.03229_90d3ebf5e7bce41be9196297449da: Our exploration of document structure demonstrates how using different types of document structure impacts summarization performance
elements.2211.03229_27c086c4e13949d8653d0a0246a67: Moreover, a document structure inspired reweighting scheme yields performance gain on the CanLII case dataset.
elements.2211.03229_bf5cb54dbaf1559a8aec55e7c8ff8: The utilization of the generated summary results of legal documents remains important
elements.2211.03229_69984edc73bd50d8177e0d9ee2ca2: Current extractive methods avoid the problem of generating hallucinated information
elements.2211.03229_89c2128884eadc340d51bb6dca03a: , which has been observed in abstractive methods that use large-scale pre-trained language models
elements.2211.03229_76d15b3735b1c73c782514ece9d43: The extracted sentences, however, may not capture the important contents of the legal documents
elements.2211.03229_82e32f6eea2bc39dd9933dd6e511b: Meanwhile, CanLII has taken measures to limit the disclosure of defendants' identities (such as blocking search indexing)
elements.2211.03229_c4b218c52774d9778a177c4411207: Thus, using the dataset may need to be taken good care of and avoid impacting those efforts.
elements.2211.03229_ee11547bb0db8e98bba60d3a10546: We thank the Pitt AI Fairness and Law group, the Pitt PETAL group, and the anonymous reviewers for their valuable feedback
elements.2211.03229_f9e88d2f3713edeb02ed7bff41d51: This research is supported by the National Science Foundation under Grant IIS-2040490 and a gift from Amazon.
elements.2211.03229_29fff6a54359ca46d923f51c31530: The dataset we used has a relatively small scale (1K) test set
elements.2211.03229_f349c69427591de1235d067431e26: Meanwhile, the automatic evaluation metrics may fall short compared to human evaluations,
elements.2211.03229_7021ffd1073ff05baef31aac9c9cd: thus unfaithfully representing the final quality of generated summaries
elements.2211.03229_6a5558c051e4f8e56726a03a49e59: Although lightweight, there is still a large performance gap between our unsupervised method and both the extractive oracles as well as abstractive models (Appendix
elements.2211.03229_5a487ece2abe0741a3db532fba02c: ), especially given the small-scale training data
elements.2211.03229_026bbafb1142d965322bb1126322d: There are more graph-based methods to aggregate information from the built graphs and we would like to explore and include more graph-based methods but selected the most relevant one in this work
elements.2211.03229_78c6f55651eee3fa826b95e3f6e1d: Moreover, our proposed reweighting paradigm heavily relied on observations about the structure of legal cases
elements.2211.03229_b3fba38c74d02d34274e3dd872f1c: Many other legal document types, such as bills and statutes, have inherently distinct structures
elements.2211.03229_43512374e86152230a79657573e2f: Our results also show the importance of finding the correct structure and weights, which can vary depending on the corpus
elements.2211.03229_c6da9953ec9f122afa06a2a75d3a2: This will require more advanced methods to find the correct structure and weights for a dataset.
elements.2211.03229_f85bd2ae3201c3c5ff9451096b582: In this section, we provide a detailed recap of the HipoRank algorithm
elements.2211.03229_867c153f82228bc1eefd6b1352d22: Our approach mainly modifies the obtained document graphs by building a
elements.2211.03229_af59c9c56a4d17cf3ebbfea47a8bd: graph and changes the final summary selection algorithms.
elements.2211.03229_9b9a827c7bc21b99ffb16651439e8: The document is first split into its sections, then into sentences
elements.2211.03229_2cb57390adc623d299d1507666506: Two levels of connections are allowed in the built hierarchical graph: intra-sectional connections and inter-sectional connections
elements.2211.03229_dc8eee3dad719804c90907cbcda7e: Following the original paper, we display a toy example of these two types of connections in Figure
elements.2211.03229_3220e5127192258f32a5ecf6f9b7c: are designed to measure a sentence's importance score inside its section
elements.2211.03229_a895c45d96f14a47807c08d257aaa: The authors built a fully-connected subgraph over all sentences in the same section, allowing for
elements.2211.03229_b799945fcd7cff080aa4dee5b2c98: edges, which are measured by a weighted version of the similarities of sentence embeddings.
elements.2211.03229_1f177d1434621ed4d6fab410db9fa: aim to model the global importance of a sentence with respect to other topics/sections in the document
elements.2211.03229_a54ce5ccd1ae8c3cb84e101f61ea7: To reduce the expensive computation of all sentence-sentence connections spanning across a document, HipoRank's authors introduce section nodes on top of sentence nodes, and only allow for
elements.2211.03229_65f62b72549d1e5522a1db98ba899: edges to model the global information.
elements.2211.03229_9f0c5c6cebaf4893dd767b051d594: Asymmetric Edge Weighting by Boundary Functions
elements.2211.03229_d7c9220b3883ce0f9e6b75bdc37f6: In order to compute the weight of an edge, HipoRank measures the similarity of sentence-sentence pairs by computing the cosine similarity of encoded sentence embeddings
elements.2211.03229_6d4934addb414b4a89b48ac7e2fbe: Similarly, for sentence-section pairs, it averages the sentences' representations in the same section, uses it as the section vector, and further computes the cosine similarity
elements.2211.03229_8814dd3e4da1c0d60c69d1630bea7: Taking two discourse hypotheses of long scientific documents into account ((1) important sentences are near the boundaries (start or end) of a text
elements.2211.03229_39cbd6bcbc0261bfab0185aeb2f12: and (2) sections near the text boundaries (start or end) are more important
elements.2211.03229_e679560c711637c810553a6e64ad0: ), the authors of HipoRank capture this asymmetry by making their hierarchical graph directed and inject asymmetric edge weighting over intra-section and inter-section connections
elements.2211.03229_ff8e36a459a33eb4395d3be1466d5: We refer to the original paper for more detailed setups and algorithm details.
elements.2211.03229_0af1ddd7303786d5ef4a04d3d6088: We talk about the importance computation approach and summary generation details in
elements.2211.03229_0cdcc5189023a7df793c144b57153: All of our experiments are conducted on Quadro RTX 5000 GPUs, each of which has 16 GB RAM
elements.2211.03229_ceae35cdc87824b24621998bda3be: For the extractive oracle baseline, we use the python package of rouge
elements.2211.03229_d84edb0881fd1ee2b451d3df5076a: to compute the ROUGE-L scores for sentence scoring.
elements.2211.03229_cd76dc9c8aaa26857f6e0c895675b: We provide details of segmentation methods mentioned in
elements.2211.03229_079c119172f7efdfb7334ed55d7e2: For sentence encoding, we use the sentence
elements.2211.03229_3dfdde025a1b4ecd82c34f025e8d7: For the HMM stage segmentation, we train a GaussianHMM model with hmmlearn
elements.2211.03229_c9d9174158cb1a92b5ff41a1d4254: , setting the number of the components at 5 and train the model for 50 iterations on the validation set
elements.2211.03229_77ec152a70ef5777aba9c482d0cb7: For C99 algorithm, we use an implementation
elements.2211.03229_8d4fb4e4e59a1916e28f2767a4188: We set the window size of 4 and std
elements.2211.03229_6e177a9edafaf9c320b7a8dbf1752: All data processing scripts are publicly available in a combined package in
elements.2211.03229_2f56242281a92cc7a18706e722f2a: EXT, the extractive model, on top of the official code base of the work of
elements.2211.03229_d678dfd1926503885488f726488d1: Since many original documents' lengths go beyond the 512 token limits, we break the full document into different chunks and train the model to extract the top-3 sentences
elements.2211.03229_10a30b2a29c52786e40447e46bf11: For hyperparameters, we use 4 GPUs, set the learning rate of 2e-3, and save the best checkpoints at every 5,000 steps
elements.2211.03229_0c3c938e438cb815f4b5e5d5f95ac: We set the batch size as 3,000, the maximum training step at 100,000, and warm-up steps at 10,000.
elements.2211.03229_5ac95b3063f8d339e3ab6428e26b8: We use off-the-shelf packages for most traditional models
elements.2211.03229_f2e4f9ec5ddcc90848c3c1640d15e: For PACSUM model, we follow the re-implementation
elements.2211.03229_a1130306edbbbe446220dc564449b: and keep the hyperparameters fixed with the original setup
elements.2211.03229_e4eb8ccf2c88a5138825052c29178: BERT-based sentence embeddings are extracted using the fine-tuned BERT model released from the original paper
elements.2211.03229_6837a5a38d0f436ceb3f3f4213a15: in the early stages of our research but found it degraded performance on the baselines
elements.2211.03229_9e92285add432ca23bcdbdb7d1067: For HipoRank, we use the publicly available code base
elements.2211.03229_3e10f47d0003f17aa46c844132aff: We experimented with various hyperparameter settings on the validation set but we find that the original hyperparamters used in the original paper for PubMed dataset seem to be the most stable and produce the best results. (
elements.2211.03229_95893951fae4f86c482856850c2a1: .) We build our reweighting model on top of the HipoRank dataset
elements.2211.03229_4c739daaffba6e53871594bf14d99: We search the threshold g (for phase transition between phases 1 and 2) between [0.3, 0.5, and 0.7], finding that 0.5 is the best for the CanLII dataset.
elements.2211.03229_936e7c3785bd0b211bb50595ca02d: We study the effects of our reweighting algorithm by comparing different models' performances on the input documents with original structures
elements.2211.03229_811a3ffed072103027f178a1f263b: , with a minor sacrifice of precision, the recall values are greatly improved with the reweighting algorithm, thus resulting in the final improvements of F1 scores.

    & applicants should be relieved from attending the trial at any other time. \\

elements.2211.03229_66580c55155071d8438c85b71e105: We show the IRC annotation of both a case and its human summary in Figure
elements.2211.03229_c83f24c9d1270b8eede6152e22a20: The heuristics for filtering the headers from cases are provided below for replication purposes; we also provide the code
elements.2211.03229_75efce1214694c59c4af1412087a2: to process the CanLII data (although it requires that the data must first be obtained through an agreement with the Canadian Legal Information Institute).
